intro: Puccinellia × beckii, commonly known as the hybrid glassworts, is a halophyte that thrives in saline and coastal environments. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in arid conditions. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in salt marshes, dunes, and other coastal habitats where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and preventing erosion. Due to its adaptability, Puccinellia × beckii is an important component of coastal ecosystems.
